italic.text: Alerting is to inform inhabitants about an impending danger, allowing the population to shelter from it. The final goal is to minimize the number of victims and minimize subsequent evacuation time.

line.text: In SWORD, a population is alerted via the urban block it populates. An urban block cannot be alerted if it is not populated. An urban block has an "alerted" status (it is either "alerted" or "not alerted"). After being "alerted", the population may be "evacuated" faster.

The agent moves toward each provided urban block. The agent stops at the border of the urban block.
Upon reaching a urban block, the agent alerts it before moving to the next unvisited urban block.
When all the urban blocks have been visited, the unit goes to the rally point.
An urban block may not be alerted if:
The urban block cannot be inhabited (the report "urban block cannot be inhabited" is displayed)
The urban block is already alerted (the trace "the urban block is already alerted" is displayed)
In this specific case, the agent decides to act on the next one.
When the rally point is reached, the mission ends.
